abstract: Exxon Mobil is to announce Tuesday an investment of $600 million in producing liquid transportation fuels from algae, in partnership with a biotechnology company founded by the genomics pioneer J. Craig Venter.
snippet: Exxon Mobil is to announce Tuesday an investment of $600 million in producing liquid transportation fuels from algae, in partnership with a biotechnology company founded by the genomics pioneer J. Craig Venter.
lead_paragraph: The oil giant Exxon Mobil, whose chief executive once mocked alternative energy by referring to ethanol as “moonshine,” is about to venture into biofuels.

headline.main: Exxon to Invest Millions to Make Fuel From Algae
